reviews.text: Great food, wonderful chef. Wish there was a way to keep all food hot while different dishes are cooking. Really don't want to eat all the rice before the main course, but rice and veggies fit cold while entree was being cooked. But very tasty!

So much fun!
DAVID was out chef and he was amazing from the food to the jokes! The food was fresh and with a great flavor and all the waiters and waitresses were nice as well. The Atmosphere is very nice even if not really quiet. It is entertaining to watch them sign happy Birthday to the customers.

Quality food everything still good I haven’t been a long time but just recently went. We had a rad  time service was great and always a good time here. Plenty of parking plenty a room to bring any size party.

This oriental steak, chicken and seafood fine dining is at the front of this style of eating out.  All the dishes are prepared to perfect often in front of you with the table being the cooking surface.  It's a good choice bring some money, unless your having lunch you will get fine food and the cost to match.

A very fun experience, but at a cost. We brought my daughter because she had never been to a hibachi grill before. She had a lot of fun and loved her cat cup ($7 collectors cup). The sushi was really good, but small. The Benihana special edition sake was fantastic. My spouse and I both ordered the samurai feast (filet mignon and jumbo shrimp), it was delicious. We also upgraded to the chicken fried rice, which again was delicious. All in all it was fantastic, I just wish we got a little more for the price. Although, part of that steep price is the show, so I understand why it was so expensive. We ended the night with a ~$200 bill for my spouse, my child, and I.
